summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for personnel to conduct victim interviews and meetings in West Palm Beach, Florida, and Los Angeles, California, as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618). The emails span from March to October 2019 and detail logistical planning for the investigation.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: He is the recipient and approver of multiple travel requests from AUSAs for the Epstein investigation. He grants permission for travel and conference room reservations.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: She is copied on the travel approval request emails, indicating her involvement in the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: She is copied on the travel approval request emails, indicating her involvement in the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation referenced as "United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618," relating to the enticement of minors for sexual activity.

connections.description: Tyrrell is the supervisor approving travel requests submitted by or involving Duncan as part of the same investigative team.
Tyrrell is the supervisor approving travel requests that involve Alleyne as part of the same investigative team.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys copied on the same travel approval emails for the Epstein investigation.
Duncan is part of the legal team investigating Epstein for enticement of minors.
Alleyne is part of the legal team investigating Epstein for enticement of minors.
Tyrrell, as a supervisor in the USAO SDNY, is overseeing the investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: The investigative team requests travel to West Palm Beach to conduct an interview, planning to reserve a hotel conference room for it.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requests travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview, with plans to reserve a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requests travel to West Palm Beach for approximately three days for meetings and victim interviews.

events.title: Travel Approval for West Palm Beach Meetings
events.description: Tyrrell approves a travel request for the team to conduct meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida Meetings
events.description: The initial travel request is made for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale for the Epstein investigation.

locations: Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY office)
keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing investigative activity by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York into Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618) from March to October 2019.
The investigation involved travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, and Los Angeles, California, specifically to conduct victim interviews, indicating active witness engagement.
The emails show a pattern of requesting and approving hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews, suggesting formal, recorded proceedings.
The case is formally described as "United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity."
The correspondence involves several Assistant U.S. Attorneys (Michele Duncan, Darlene Alleyne) and their supervisor (Edward Tyrrell), outlining the team structure working on the case.
